node.title: Lifting welfare was a COVID-era experiment. Juanita is one of the people who want to make it permanent
node.description: Giving everyone a bit of money to live on could end up giving back a lot more to everyone in society, experts in basic income argue.
node.content:
["Single mother Juanita McLaren never stops thinking about money, because she doesn't have it.", "\"It's the number one thing that is going on in your head at all times,\" she says.", "\"If someone invites you to a job interview, your first thought is,\u00a0'How am I going to afford to get in there? Do I have access to [the] internet?'", "\"And it just goes on all day. And when you go to bed at night, you feel crap about yourself\u00a0because you're not doing as well as you're supposed to be.\"", "But it hasn't always been this way \u2014\u00a0and it might not have to be.", "Tomorrow a conference\u00a0called Basic Income after COVID-19 \u2014\u00a0Social Security, Work and\u00a0Wealth\u00a0will discuss the concept of giving a living wage to everyone\u00a0who needs it.", "It's an economic idea that has rocketed from being a\u00a0fringe academic theory to being debated in the US presidential primaries and a key policy of what is potentially South Korea's next government.", "Universal basic income (UBI) is the\u00a0concept of providing\u00a0a low payment to everyone, removing the stigma of welfare payments. Its trimmed-down\u00a0cousin, basic income, sees\u00a0an amount that covers living expenses provided to those who\u00a0need it, such as the unemployed, the elderly and carers.", "For conference organiser, Elise Klein, the economic crisis of 2020 proved the merit of the idea, as a $550 a fortnight coronavirus supplement\u00a0essentially doubled the value of welfare payments such as JobSeeker\u00a0and gave millions of people enough money to live on.", "", "
Elise Klein is one of the organisers of the basic income conference.(Supplied)
", "\"This idea that if you just give people money, people do nothing, actually wasn't the case at all,\" she says.", "\"People are extremely busy, extremely productive. And we saw that with this natural experiment from the federal government that acted like a basic income.\"", "\"The money made it easier for people to engage back into the labour market, people were able to afford a bike to get to job interviews \u2026\u00a0to take public transport, people were able to start study.\"", "
COVID shock
", "The rapid spread of COVID-19 in early 2020 shocked the world.", "Australia's\u00a0economy shuddered to a stop as concepts that then seemed far fetched \u2014\u00a0lockdowns, social distancing, working from home, travel bans \u2014\u00a0took hold.", "Pressed by unions, employers and long queues outside Centrelink, the government announced two radical programs: the JobKeeper wage subsidy and the coronavirus supplement that virtually doubled existing payments for people on welfare.", "By giving people an amount of money that put them above the poverty line, more than a\u00a0million welfare recipients took part in a natural experiment.", "For Ms McLaren, the mother of three boys, 2020 was a great year. Increased financial support allowed her family to eat regularly, pay down debt and it saw her better prepared for work.", "\"To get that supplement meant that I was able to go and get the vacuum cleaner fixed. I know that sounds ridiculous!\" she says, laughing.", "\"It gave me something to live off. And so that in itself was great.", "\"And because I had three kids at home \u2014\u00a0all homeschooling \u2014\u00a0and I was either working or looking for work, it allowed me to just catch up on some of the expenses that I can't normally meet.\"", "
Billions in cost
", "The biggest barrier is the obvious one:\u00a0cost.", "There were more than 5.4 million people who received an income support payment in June this year, according to government data. People on the age pension make up 2.6 million of that figure.", "Welfare services and payments equated to about $196 billion in\u00a02019-20, or around a third of the overall federal budget.", "\"I think what we learned is that welfare can be very expensive,\" says\u00a0Simon Cowan, research director for conservative think tank\u00a0The Centre for Independent Studies.", "", "
Simon Cowan says the COVID-19 payments showed \"welfare can be very expensive\".(ABC News: John Gunn)
", "In 2017 he estimated a UBI where everyone over the age of 18 was given $10,000 a year, with a \"top-up\"\u00a0for welfare recipients, would cost $103\u00a0billion per annum.", "Mr Cowan is not alone in criticising the level and composition of the JobSeeker payment, previously called Newstart or, colloquially, the dole.", "He sees it as lumping together disparate groups \u2014\u00a0the temporarily employed, single working parents, the long-term unemployed \u2014\u00a0who need different types of assistance.", "\"It was introduced at a time when unemployment was below 2 per cent,\" he says.", "\"The idea of long-term unemployment \u2014\u00a0that someone that could go years, and even potentially decades, without having a job \u2014\u00a0was almost unknown.", "\"So it really wasn't designed for the purpose that it serves.\"", "But he's not sold on the idea of introducing a UBI, pointing to an academic's summation: You can have a broad-based system, you can have a generous system, and you can have a system that's affordable.", "\"However, you can only pick two of those things,\" he warns.", "Peter Burn, chief policy adviser for business lobby AI Group, makes the point that the exceptional nature of the COVID-19 crisis needs to be considered when weighing an issue like basic income.", "He saw a disincentive to work come from the way some payments were made. The design of JobKeeper meant some part-time workers received more money for doing nothing than when they were working their previously scheduled hours.", "\"Their employer had said,\u00a0'You can return to work. We now have work for you.' And they didn't do so. That was a frequent complaint,\" Mr Burn says.", "But that doesn't mean it's the full picture of the impact of a basic income. It's a contested field.", "\"The academic literature is divided on it, as you might expect,\" he says.", "\"Different academics coming from different perspectives, and certainly using different methodologies, don't come down on a universal answer.", "\"And, sadly, that often matches the answer they want to get.\"", "
Cost shifting
", "Susan Maury is a policy expert at Good Shepherd, an organisation that provides support for women suffering family violence, financial insecurity and disadvantage.", "She says\u00a0the coronavirus supplement acted as a pilot\u00a0program for\u00a0what a basic income could look like in Australia \u2014\u00a0and she was encouraged by the results.", "", "
Dr Susan Maury, policy and research specialist at Good Shepherd, says\u00a0the welfare system is deliberately complex.(ABC News: Billy Draper)
", "\"The impact was phenomenal,\" she says.", "People surveyed for the report titled Social security and time use during COVID-19 said\u00a0they used both the money and time well.", "With mutual obligation programs like the Work For The Dole program suspended, respondents noted increasing physical and mental health, more time studying and preparing to work.\u00a0", "\"It really had an incredible impact,\" Dr Maury says", "The coronavirus supplement cost taxpayers $20 billion and supported nearly 3 million people\u00a0(It was subsequently stepped down before ending in March 2021).", "Dr Maury argues the money was well spent, and that without it the expenses would have been \"pushed into other categories\" like the social services which charities such as\u00a0Good Shepherd provide.", "\"The way productivity tends to be measured currently is through employment, it's through our economy,\" she says.", "\"But with the basic income, and also with the coronavirus supplement, as it showed, it was much more supportive of a very holistic perspective on productivity.", "
Political momentum
", "Tomorrow's conference is hosted by the Australian Basic Income Lab, a research collaboration between the University of Sydney, Australian National University and Macquarie University.", "It is being held just months before a federal election in which housing affordability and inequality are shaping up as key issues\u00a0and after a period in which millions of people have been supported by the welfare system,\u00a0many for the first time.", "For people like Ms McLaren, who interviewed participants for Good Shepherd's research, her lived experience and that of the women she spoke to is that the \"hoop jumping\" involved in getting help from Centrelink is as taxing as the low rate of support given.", "", "
Juanita McLaren says 60 per cent of her income and welfare payments is spent on rent.(ABC News: Billy Draper)
", "\"The system in itself keeps you in a state of constant poverty,\" she says.", "\"You're actually working virtually full time to be just trying to get the basic income that you deserve.\"", "Ms McLaren argues a basic income \u2014\u00a0providing enough to deal with soaring housing costs \u2014\u00a0would help people contribute more to society and move into paying work."]
